title: People Are Making Memes About Struggles of Not Stepping On Rangoli On Diwali, And We Feel Them!
text:
People Are Making Memes About Struggles of Not Stepping On Rangoli On Diwali, And We Feel Them!

People Are Making Memes About Struggles of Not Stepping On Rangoli On Diwali, And We Feel Them!

It's the festival of Diwali, of lights and sweets, let’s just keep the firecrackers out of the equation? After Twitter was done dissing Soan Papdi as a Diwali sweet, it has now moved on to making fun of rangoli and what a struggle it can be to make one.

Being the person who actually makes rangoli every year - even after officially being certified as a non-creative, non-artistic person by my nursery teacher who gave me a C+ in art and craft - I feel these people. I mean, first, I am under the pressure of outdoing what I did last year, then I have to actually do it and then live in the constant fear that someone will step over or tumble on my finest piece of work.

It is just too much stress. Then there are those on the Internet who cannot get over the need for rangoli-making competitions in offices. Below are some of the finest memes and observations about rangoli, that people have come up with. Be it regarding how to create one or how not to destroy one.
